snippet: The group’s leadership in Pakistan has secretly dispatched seasoned veterans there to create an alternate headquarters and compete with the Islamic State.
abstract: Intelligence officials report Al Qaeda has sent over dozen of its most experienced fighters to Syria, anticipating group's future lies there after being badly weakened by decade of CIA drone strikes in Pakistan; move points to Syria's growing importance for group and likelihood of clashes with rival Islamic State.

byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard contributed reporting from Riyadh, Saudi Arabia, and Anne Barnard from Beirut, Lebanon.

lead_paragraph: The group’s leadership in Pakistan has secretly dispatched seasoned veterans there to create an alternate headquarters and compete with the Islamic State.

headline.main: Al Qaeda Turns to Syria, With a Plan to Challenge ISIS
headline.print_headline: Weakened Al Qaeda Turns to Syria, With Plan to Challenge ISIS

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
